questions.Question: Description of what services that system is expected to provide and the constraints under which it must operate.
Detailed information about the system functions, services and operational constraints that are to be implemented.
Statements of the services that a system should provide, how the system should react to particular input and how the system should behave in particular situations.
Constraints (timing, performance, reliability, development process, standards) on the services or functions offered by the system; normally apply to the system as a whole.
Creation of a simple working model of system to show users what requirements may look like when implemented.
Its main goal is to build a very robust prototype in a structured manner and constantly refine it.
Way of structuring requirements to represent perspectives of different stakeholders.
Graphical representations that describe the business process and the system to be developed.
Defines a generic structure for a requirements document.
questions.Alt-Answer: The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

questions.Question: Assessment of the quality of the requirements.
Process of identifying, understanding, tracking and controlling changes to system requirements.
People or systems that interact directly with the system.
Domain characteristics and constraints that influence the requirements.
